} else if (NPCID == 944) { // pking shop
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = 42;[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 31, 2009, 09:34:14 am[/size][hr]ok now i added all that junk in client.java, shop.cfg, and npchandler.java but still when i trade or talk it still won’t work[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 31, 2009, 01:58:21 pm[/size][hr]how do i make a place wildy? like for example pkbox?

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS, post:7, topic:311591”][quote author=Telenim link=topic=408038.msg3012852#msg3012852 date=1256973186]

What base are you using?
[/quote]The base doesn’t matter. Are you actually trying to help or just post “what base?” in every topic?

Because from inference from the rest of this forum, many members lack intelligence of Java.[/quote]Ah, this is explains why you want that pro coder dude to code your server in that other topic

[quote=“gangsta tony, post:8, topic:311591”]also umm how do i add items to a shop… i put it in shop.cfg but when i try trading it won’t work… please help me…[/quote]You need to do the wanneShop part before anything will work, also try just talking to the shop and not trading, and just explore shops.cfg to add more items it is really easy to understand :eek:

item.title: Objects
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Just combine all your questions into one topic, instead of 10 different ones.

If you mean you want to remove an object and add it somewhere else, you will have to find the makeGlobalObject line it is using, if you can’t find it then it’s probably an object in there by default, so you can remove it by using deleteThatObject (exactly the same way makeGlobalObject is used) and then if you want to re add it somewhere else you just use makeGlobalObject again, simple enough?

Read full topic
